ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 6-8, depending on if it was a week where written responses were due

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: This course was incredible because it wasn't challenging in the sense that it was full of busy work, but it was challenging due to the pressure to think strategically about various problems and topics. I loved that I continually felt challenged to produce creative work. In other courses it is really easy to figure out what the professor expects in terms of assignments and be able to regurgitate information and prepare deliverables that fulfill their requirements. This class is different in that Dr. Tol seemed most impressed by things that were outside of the box and reflected innovative thought.
There were great reading selections and guest lecturers.However, I would have liked more group activities and more structured class discussions.
The course would be better if each class had a clearer content.

I felt that the class was very engaging, and really opened up my mind to the humanitarian disasters that are taking place around the world and the how we can create an impact in these situations through psychosocial support. I really enjoyed the interactive nature of the class and learning from my classmates.
strengths:discussionuse of pyramiddiverse backgrounds of studentslimitations:

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Wietse Anton Tol  Dr. Tol is an incredible professor. I have never had a better class at YSPH. He acts as a leader in the sense that he facilitates great discussion rather than talking at the students.
Instructor: Wietse Anton Tol  He selected great readings but I would have liked for him to give more structure to the course.
Instructor: Wietse Anton Tol  Where to improve:be more sensitive to the flow of discussion and lead it back if discussion goes to the irrelevant direction.
Instructor: Wietse Anton Tol  Excellent instruction -- brought great expertise. Class discussion sometimes wandered but generally class time was engaging and enlightening.

Instructor: Wietse Anton Tol  strengths:clearly expert in fieldfacilitates discussion well (e.g. lets people talk, yet knows when to (gently) correct people when discussion is off track or simply incorrect)

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Best course at YSPH. YSPH needs to recruit more global mental health professionals since they are going to miss out on having Dr. Tol.
I would definitely would recommend this course.
Good exposure to mental health issues in humanitarian settings.
Yes, I would recommend this course should it be offered again.
discussion based interdisciplinary study of mental health issues in disaster settings. great course. highly recommend.
